p: Cosmetic products containing A. vulgaris extracts are available on the European, Asian, and American markets. The species is of particular interest to South Korean companies such as Hanyul, Missha, Isntree, Iâ€™m From, Round lab, VelyVely, Dr. Jart+, and Tonymoly. They produce cosmetics (mainly in the form of creams) using the extracts of A. vulgaris herb, which are intended for skincare. In Russia, PervoeReshenie, Etude House, Natura Siberica, and Fitocosmetic use A. vulgaris in the production of, for example, toothpastes, balms, and creams. The plant extracts are also found in the products sold by American cosmetic companies, including Soleil Toujours, AoSkincare, and TruBaby.
